title: Expressions

version_changes.summary: Major increase in expression usage due to expanded FFI layer, union support, and no_std compatibility. Unsafe blocks increased 39% (1702->2372), method calls increased 50% (19003->28421), closures increased 157% (636->1638).
key_changes: New const block usage in StaticVec initialization

summary: FLS Chapter 6 defines expressions - constructs that produce values and may have side effects. Expressions are categorized as expression-with-block or expression-without-block.

findings.description: Assignee expressions can appear on the left side of assignment. Used for variables, fields, and array indexing.
Expressions evaluable at compile time. Used for const declarations, array lengths, and const generics.
Expressions that never complete normally (panic!, return, break, continue).

samples.code: fatal_panic!(from self, "This should never happen! Accessing wrong messaging pattern in RequestResponse builder!");
fatal_panic!(from self, "This should never happen! Accessing wrong messaging pattern in PublishSubscribe builder!");

findings.description: Expressions representing memory locations. Variables, dereferences, field accesses, and indexing.

findings.description: Expressions that produce values rather than locations. Literals, function calls, operators.

findings.description: Bitwise operators (&, |, ^, <<, >>) used for flags and low-level manipulation.
Comparison operators (==, !=, <, >, <=, >=) for ordering and equality.
Short-circuit operators (&&, ||) for boolean logic with lazy evaluation.
&raw const and &raw mut for creating raw pointers without going through references.
